text: Pitcairnia alata is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador, where it is known from only two subpopulations in Zamora- Chinchipe Province. This epiphyte was initially discovered along the Río Valladolid between Quebrada Honda and Tambo Valladolid.Pitcairnia alata. FCBS Bromeliad Directory. Its natural habitat is the forests of the high Andes. It is threatened by habitat destruction as forest is cleared for agriculture. ==Notes== ==References== * Valencia, R., Pitman, N., León-Yánez, S. and Jørgensen, P.M. (eds). 2000.
